H0.text: What is the term for a person whose body doesn't produce melanin. Leucistic

H1.text: What is the term for a person whose body doesn't produce melanin. Hypopigmented

H2.text: What is the term for a person whose body doesn't produce melanin. Amelanic

H3.text: What is the term for a person whose body doesn't produce melanin. Albino

A4.text: Leucism differs from albinism in that the melanin is, at least, partially absent but the eyes retain their usual colour.

A5.text: Albinism is the congenital absence of melanin in an animal or plant resulting in white hair, feathers, scales and skin and red, pink, purple, or blue eyes.

A6.text: Albinism is a well-recognized phenomenon in molluscs, both in the shell and in the soft parts.

A7.text: Albinism results in the reduction of melanin production only, though the melanocyte (or melanophore) is still present.

A9.text: Amelanism is a pigmentation abnormality characterized by the lack of pigments called melanins.

A10.text: For a mammal to be unable to chemically manufacture melanin renders it completely pigmentless. This condition is more commonly called albinism.
